IMPLEMENTATION GUIDANCE: - Immediate actions (today): - Admit the patient to a hospital setting with intensive monitoring capability. - Obtain confirmatory blood smears and PCR testing for Plasmodium falciparum. - Start IV artesunate (preferred first-line in severe malaria) as early as possible, if available, or IV quinidine if artesunate is unavailable, following institutional protocols. - Initiate supportive care: IV fluids to maintain hydration, correction of electrolyte imbalances, and control of seizures if present. - Monitor vital signs, neurological status, and blood smears frequently.  - Short-term goals (1-4 weeks): - Achieve parasitemia clearance confirmed by negative blood smears. - Manage cerebral edema and prevent secondary neurological injury through appropriate ICU care. - Address complications such as hypoglycemia, anemia, or coagulopathy with targeted interventions. - Begin transition to oral antimalarials (e.g., artemisinin-based combination therapy) after stabilization per guidelines.  - Long-term objectives (3-6 months): - Ensure complete parasite eradication and prevent relapse. - Conduct neurological reassessment; implement follow-up neurorehabilitation as needed. - Educate the patient on prevention of future malaria, including vector control and prophylaxis.  - Patient handout summary: - "You have a severe form of malaria that has affected your brain.
